intro: Euporteria nigrihorrida, commonly known as the black-hairy euporteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its dark green, hairy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish in color. The plant is native to parts of Africa and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in horticulture and plant taxonomy.
